feed.title: Security Advisory for Go modules
feed.subtitle: Security Advisory for Go modules on GitHub

entry.title: [github.com/mattermost/mattermost-server/v6] Mattermost Improper Access Control vulnerability
entry.content:
Mattermost fails to perform proper authorization in the /plugins/focalboard/api/v2/users endpoint allowing an attacker who is a guest user and knows the ID of another user to get their information (e.g. name, surname, nickname) via Mattermost Boards.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-6202
  • https://mattermost.com/security-updates
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-85jj-c9jr-9jhx

entry.title: [github.com/mattermost/mattermost-server/v6] Mattermost Improper Access Control vulnerability
entry.content:
Mattermost fails to check if hardened mode is enabled when overriding the username and/or the icon when posting a post. If settings allowed integrations to override the username and profile picture when posting, a member could also override the username and icon when making a post even if the Hardened Mode setting was enabled

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-47865
  • https://mattermost.com/security-updates
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-jj46-9cgh-qmfx

entry.title: [github.com/mattermost/mattermost/server/v8] Mattermost Improper Access Control vulnerability
entry.content:
Mattermost fails to check if hardened mode is enabled when overriding the username and/or the icon when posting a post. If settings allowed integrations to override the username and profile picture when posting, a member could also override the username and icon when making a post even if the Hardened Mode setting was enabled

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-47865
  • https://mattermost.com/security-updates
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-jj46-9cgh-qmfx

entry.title: [github.com/mattermost/mattermost-server/v6] Mattermost Injection vulnerability
entry.content:
Mattermost fails to use innerText / textContent when setting the channel name in the webapp during autocomplete, allowing an attacker to inject HTML to a victim's page by create a channel name that is valid HTML. No XSS is possible though.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-35075
  • https://mattermost.com/security-updates
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-jcgv-3pfq-j4hr

entry.title: [github.com/mattermost/mattermost/server/v8] Mattermost Injection vulnerability
entry.content:

  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-jcgv-3pfq-j4hr

entry.title: [github.com/mattermost/mattermost-server/v6] Mattermost Uncontrolled Resource Consumption vulnerability
entry.content:
Mattermost fails to properly limit the characters allowed in different fields of a block in Mattermost Boards allowing a attacker to consume excessive resources, possibly leading to Denial of Service, by patching the field of a block using a specially crafted string. 

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-40703
  • https://mattermost.com/security-updates
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-c37r-v8jx-7cv2

entry.title: [github.com/mattermost/mattermost-server/v6] Mattermost Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor vulnerability
entry.content:
Mattermost fails to check whether the "Allow users to view archived channels" setting is enabled during permalink previews display, allowing members to view permalink previews of archived channels even if the "Allow users to view archived channels" setting is disabled. 

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-43754
  • https://mattermost.com/security-updates
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-jjr7-372r-cx7x

entry.title: [github.com/mattermost/mattermost-server/v6] Mattermost Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor vulnerability
entry.content:
Mattermost fails to properly validate the "Show Full Name" option in a few endpoints in Mattermost Boards, allowing a member to get the full name of another user even if the Show Full Name option was disabled. 

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-45223
  • https://mattermost.com/security-updates
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-p5pr-vm3j-jxxf

entry.title: [github.com/mattermost/mattermost/server/v8] Mattermost Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor vulnerability
entry.content:
Mattermost fails to properly validate the "Show Full Name" option in a few endpoints in Mattermost Boards, allowing a member to get the full name of another user even if the Show Full Name option was disabled. 

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-45223
  • https://mattermost.com/security-updates
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-p5pr-vm3j-jxxf

entry.title: [github.com/mattermost/mattermost-server/v6] Mattermost Open Redirect vulnerability
entry.content:
Mattermost fails to properly check a redirect URL parameter allowing for an open redirect was possible when the user clicked "Back to Mattermost" after providing a invalid custom url scheme in /oauth/{service}/mobile_login?redirect_to=

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-47168
  • https://mattermost.com/security-updates
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-4ghx-8jw8-p76q

entry.title: [github.com/mattermost/mattermost/server/v8] Mattermost Open Redirect vulnerability
entry.content:
Mattermost fails to properly check a redirect URL parameter allowing for an open redirect was possible when the user clicked "Back to Mattermost" after providing a invalid custom url scheme in /oauth/{service}/mobile_login?redirect_to=

References

  • https://mattermost.com/security-updates
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-4ghx-8jw8-p76q
